0: Prepare and process import and export documentation according to customs regulations, laws, or procedures.
Clear goods through customs and to their destinations for clients.
Pay, or arrange for payment of, taxes and duties on shipments.
Calculate duty and tariff payments owed on shipments.
Request or compile necessary import documentation, such as customs invoices, certificates of origin, and cargo-control documents.
Classify goods according to tariff coding system.
Stay abreast of changes in import or export laws or regulations by reading current literature, attending meetings or conferences, or conferring with colleagues.
Sign documents on behalf of clients, using powers of attorney.
Advise customers on import and export restrictions, tariff systems, insurance requirements, quotas, or other customs-related matters.
Post bonds for the products being imported or assist clients in obtaining bonds.
Quote duty and tax rates on goods to be imported, based on federal tariffs and excise taxes.
Arrange for transportation, warehousing, or product distribution of imported or exported products.
Monitor or trace the location of goods.
Confer with officials in various agencies to facilitate clearance of goods through customs and quarantine.
Inform importers and exporters of steps to reduce duties and taxes.
Obtain line releases for frequent shippers of low-risk commodities, high-volume entries, or multiple-container loads.
Provide advice on transportation options, types of carriers, or shipping routes.
Contract with freight forwarders for destination services.
Apply for tariff concessions or for duty drawbacks and other refunds.
Insure cargo against loss, damage, or pilferage.
Prepare papers for shippers to appeal duty charges.
1: Analyze training needs to develop new training programs or modify and improve existing programs.
Evaluate instructor performance and the effectiveness of training programs, providing recommendations for improvement.

Plan, develop, and provide training and staff development programs, using knowledge of the effectiveness of methods such as classroom training, demonstrations, on-the-job training, meetings, conferences, and workshops.
Confer with management and conduct surveys to identify training needs based on projected production processes, changes, and other factors.
Conduct orientation sessions and arrange on-the-job training for new hires.
Train instructors and supervisors in techniques and skills for training and dealing with employees.
Develop and organize training manuals, multimedia visual aids, and other educational materials.
Prepare training budget for department or organization.
Develop testing and evaluation procedures.
Conduct or arrange for ongoing technical training and personal development classes for staff members.
Review and evaluate training and apprenticeship programs for compliance with government standards.
2: Monitor and record food temperatures to ensure food safety.
Cook foodstuffs according to menus, special dietary or nutritional restrictions, or numbers of portions to be served.
Rotate and store food supplies.
Wash pots, pans, dishes, utensils, or other cooking equipment.
Apportion and serve food to facility residents, employees, or patrons.
Clean and inspect galley equipment, kitchen appliances, and work areas to ensure cleanliness and functional operation.
Clean, cut, and cook meat, fish, or poultry.
Direct activities of one or more workers who assist in preparing and serving meals.
Train new employees.
Take inventory of supplies and equipment.
Requisition food supplies, kitchen equipment, and appliances, based on estimates of future needs.
Bake breads, rolls, or other pastries.

0: Verify import-export documentation accuracy and completeness for clients.
Negotiate with carriers, freight forwarders, or customs authorities to resolve delivery issues or delays.
Conduct risk assessments to determine potential compliance risks associated with imports or exports.
Prepare and submit import/export shipments to relevant regulatory bodies, including US Customs and Border Protection (CBP) for clearance.
Coordinate with local law enforcement agencies regarding shipments that may require detention or seizure.
Analyze commercial invoices, bills of lading, and other shipping documents to ensure compliance with customs regulations.
Obtain necessary licenses, permits, and certifications from regulatory bodies before clearing shipments.
Communicate with clients to clarify shipment details, provide status updates, and address concerns regarding delivery.
Develop and implement customs brokerage policies and procedures that meet or exceed industry standards.
Prepare and submit export compliance documentation, including the Export Control Classification Number (ECCN) filing, for domestic companies.
Conduct on-site audits of warehouses, distribution centers, and other facilities to ensure compliance with customs regulations.
Provide training and education to clients on customs brokerage best practices, regulatory updates, and industry standards.
Negotiate with carriers or freight forwarders to secure the best rates and services for clients' shipments.
Investigate and resolve discrepancies in shipments, including damaged goods claims or missing shipment notices.
Coordinate with customs brokers in other countries to facilitate international trade agreements and compliance.
Prepare and submit Harmonized System (HS) codes and other product classification information for accurate customs clearance.
Maintain up-to-date knowledge of changing regulations, laws, and industry standards affecting customs brokerage practices.
Prepare and present export control submissions, including the required documentation and filing procedures, for domestic companies.
Coordinate with clients to arrange for insurance coverage for high-value shipments or shipments with unique value requirements.

1: Develop and implement a comprehensive training program to enhance employee skills and knowledge in a specific industry or function.
Evaluate the effectiveness of existing training programs, making recommendations for improvements and updates as needed.
Schedule and coordinate training sessions, workshops, and conferences for employees, ensuring timely registration and logistical arrangements.
Create and manage a centralized database of training records, tracking participant engagement, completion rates, and certification status.
Craft engaging and interactive training materials, including e-learning modules, videos, and hands-on exercises, to cater to diverse learning styles.
Foster partnerships with external organizations and vendors to provide employees with access to specialized training, tools, and resources.
Design and deliver soft skills training programs to enhance leadership development, communication, and interpersonal skills among managers and team members.
Conduct needs assessments to identify skill gaps and areas for improvement within the organization, informing targeted training initiatives.
Collaborate with subject matter experts to develop and review curriculum content, ensuring accuracy, relevance, and alignment with organizational goals.
Analyze training evaluation data to inform program adjustments, measure ROI, and optimize future training investments.
Establish a culture of continuous learning within the organization, promoting employee autonomy, self-directed development, and innovation.
2: Prepare and cook menu items in accordance with institutional recipes and food safety guidelines.
Plan and organize menu rotations to ensure diversity and variety for cafeteria patrons.
Maintain a clean and sanitary kitchen environment, adhering to health department regulations.
Prepare ingredients for the day's meals, including chopping vegetables, marinating meats, and mixing sauces.
Sauté or stir-fry food items according to recipe specifications.
Set up and manage buffet displays to ensure attractive and safe presentation of menu items.
Monitor kitchen temperatures and appliance performance to maintain optimal cooking conditions.
Store leftover ingredients and prepared meals in designated areas to prevent spoilage.
Clean and sanitize equipment, utensils, and work surfaces after each meal service.
Assist with food preparation for special events or catering functions as required.
Maintain inventory levels of pantry staples and menu ingredients to ensure efficient ordering and waste reduction.
Collaborate with dietary staff to accommodate specific customer needs, such as vegetarian, gluten-free, or other requests.
